title: Excel Basic Quiz
description: Test your basic Excel knowledge with fundamental concepts and operations

questions.question: What is the default file extension for Excel workbooks in Excel 2016 and later?
questions.explanation: Excel 2007 and later versions use .xlsx as the default file extension for workbooks.

questions.question: Which key combination is used to select all cells in a worksheet?
questions.explanation: Ctrl + A selects all cells in the current worksheet.

questions.question: What is a cell reference in Excel?
options: The address of a cell using column letter and row number
questions.explanation: A cell reference is the address of a cell, combining the column letter and row number (e.g., A1, B5).

questions.question: Which symbol is used to start a formula in Excel?
questions.explanation: All Excel formulas must start with the equals sign (=).

questions.question: What does the SUM function do in Excel?
options: Adds up all the numbers in a range
questions.explanation: The SUM function adds up all the numbers in a specified range of cells.

questions.question: How do you move to the next cell when entering data?
questions.explanation: Pressing Enter moves down to the next cell, and Tab moves to the next cell to the right.

questions.question: What is a worksheet in Excel?
options: A single sheet within a workbook
questions.explanation: A worksheet is a single sheet within an Excel workbook, containing rows and columns of cells.

questions.question: Which function key opens the 'Go To' dialog box?
questions.explanation: F5 opens the 'Go To' dialog box, allowing you to navigate to specific cells or ranges.

questions.question: What is the maximum number of rows in an Excel worksheet?
questions.explanation: Excel worksheets can have up to 1,048,576 rows.

questions.question: How do you copy a cell in Excel?
questions.explanation: Ctrl + C copies the selected cell or range to the clipboard.

questions.question: What does AutoFill do in Excel?
options: Fills cells with a series or pattern
questions.explanation: AutoFill automatically fills cells with a series, pattern, or copies data based on adjacent cells.

questions.question: Which tab contains the formatting options for cells?
questions.explanation: The Home tab contains most formatting options including font, alignment, and number formatting.

questions.question: What is the name box in Excel?
options: Shows the address of the active cell
questions.explanation: The name box displays the address of the currently selected cell or range.

questions.question: How do you undo an action in Excel?
questions.explanation: Ctrl + Z undoes the last action performed in Excel.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the formula bar?
options: To show and edit the contents of the active cell
questions.explanation: The formula bar displays and allows editing of the contents of the active cell, including formulas.

questions.question: Which function calculates the average of a range of numbers?
questions.explanation: The AVERAGE function calculates the arithmetic mean of a range of numbers.

questions.question: How do you select an entire row in Excel?
options: Double-click any cell in the row
questions.explanation: Clicking on the row number (on the left side) selects the entire row.

questions.question: What does Ctrl + S do in Excel?
questions.explanation: Ctrl + S saves the current workbook.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a valid Excel data type?
questions.explanation: While Excel can display images, 'Image' is not a fundamental data type like Text, Number, and Date.

questions.question: What happens when you double-click on a cell?
questions.explanation: Double-clicking on a cell puts it into edit mode, allowing you to modify its contents directly.
